title: Science Headlines
description: Lists press releases related to the Office of Science
cleaned_text: Digital Twins at AIRES 4 Workshop](https://www.ornl.gov/news/ai-professionals-discern-digital-twins-aires-4-workshop) DOE's Oak Ridge National Laboratory hosted its fourth Artificial Intelligence for Robust Engineering and Science, or AIRES, workshop from April 18-20. August 15, 2023 [Four Brookhaven Scientists Receive Early Career Research Awards](https://www.bnl.gov/newsroom/news.php?a=121335) DOE is recognizing a total of 93 awardees representing 47 universities and 12 DOE national laboratories in 27 states. August 14, 2023 [Electrons Now Moving Through the Superconducting Accelerator That Will Power SLAC's X-Ray Laser](https://www6.slac.stanford.edu/news/2023-08-07-electrons-now-moving-through-superconducting-accelerator-will-power-slacs-x-ray) The facility is now steps away from releasing an unprecedented stream of ultra-bright X-rays. August 14, 2023 [Indian scientists Come to Fermilab to Assist With PIP-II Particle Accelerator Technology](https://news.fnal.gov/2023/08/indian-scientists-come-to-fermilab-to-assist-with-pip-ii-particle-accelerator-technology/) A team at India's Raja Rammana Centre for Advanced Technology designed, developed, and built amplifiers for the Proton Improvement Plan II project. August 14, 2023 [Researchers Strengthen Defenses Against Common Cyberattack](https://www.pnnl.gov/news-media/researchers-strengthen-defenses-against-common-cyberattack) Scientists have developed a better way to recognize a common internet attack, improving detection by 90 percent compared to current methods. August 11, 2023 [2 Fermilab Researchers Have Received 2023 DOE Early Career Research Awards](https://news.fnal.gov/2023/08/2-fermilab-researchers-have-received-2023-doe-early-career-research-awards/) Guillermo Fernandez Moroni and Silvia Zorzetti will receive grants for more than $400,000 per year. August 11, 2023 [Scientists Dig Into Wildfire Predictions, Long-Term Impacts](https://www.ornl.gov/news/scientists-dig-wildfire-predictions-long-term-impacts) Scientists are working on several fronts to better understand and predict wildfire events and what they mean for the carbon cycle and biodiversity. August 11, 2023 [Calculations Reveal High-Resolution View of Quarks Inside Protons](https://www.bnl.gov/newsroom/news.php?a=121380) Theorists predict differential distribution of 'up' and 'down' quarks within protons—and differential contributions to proton's properties. August 10, 2023 [Researchers Show How to Increase X-Ray Laser Brightness and Power Using a Crystal Cavity and Diamond Mirrors](https://www6.slac.stanford.edu/news/2023-08-02-researchers-show-how-increase-x-ray-laser-brightness-and-power-using-crystal-cavity) The long - but not too long - cavity would ping-pong X-ray pulses inside of a particle accelerator facility to help capture nature's fastest movements August 10, 2023 [Berkeley Lab Researchers Receive DOE Early Career Research Awards](https://newscenter.lbl.gov/2023/08/04/berkeley-lab-researchers-receive-doe-early-career-awards/) The ECRP program, now in its 14th year, bolsters the nation's scientific workforce by supporting exceptional researchers at the outset of their career
